senses.de: To give someone the right to do or have something
senses.ex: Being a citizen entitles one to certain rights and privileges.

Tips.title: Rights Granted
Tips.description: Focus on the granted rights and legal aspects when using 'entitle' in this context.
Tips.example: Owning property entitles you to certain legal protections.

Tips.title: Not Always Obvious
Tips.description: 'Entitle' often refers to rights that aren't immediately visible, like privacy or free speech.
Tips.example: A subscription entitles you to access exclusive content.

Tips.title: No Physical Object
Tips.description: Remember, 'entitle' does not imply receiving a physical item, but rather a right or benefit.
Tips.example: Your ticket entitles you to a seat, not a gift.

senses.de: To give a title to a book, article, or work of art
senses.ex: She entitled her latest painting 'Sunset on the Sea'.

Tips.title: Creative Naming
Tips.description: Use 'entitle' to express the act of naming creative works for impact or description.
Tips.example: The director entitled the movie 'The Quiet Echo'.

Tips.title: Lasting Impression
Tips.description: A thought-provoking title can entitle a work to long-term recognition.
Tips.example: The photograph was entitled 'The Plight of the Refugees'.

Tips.title: Reflect Content
Tips.description: Titles should give insight into the content or theme of the work.

senses.de: To believe you have the right to behave in a particular way, often without considering others
senses.ex: He's rich and successful, but that doesn't entitle him to treat people badly.

Tips.title: Unjustified Expectation
Tips.description: This form of 'entitle' hints at undeserved or inappropriate demands or behavior.
Tips.example: Just because you're famous doesn't entitle you to special treatment.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: 'Entitle' can have a negative tone, suggesting arrogance or privilege.
Tips.example: His entitled attitude made it difficult to work with him.

Tips.title: Impact on Others
Tips.description: Focus on how one's entitled behavior may negatively affect others in social environments.
Tips.example: She acted as if her status entitled her to ignore the queue.

Allow.wordDefinition:
Allow means to give permission or consent to someone or something to do something. For example, a parent may allow their child to stay out late with friends.

Allow gives permission while entitle gives a right. Allow is applicable in situations where permission needs to be granted, while entitle is applicable in situations where someone deserves or qualifies for something.

Authorize.wordDefinition:
Authorize means to give permission to do something, while the word entitle means to give someone a right to something.

For example, a parent may authorize their child to use their credit card for a specific purchase. This means the child has permission to use the credit card for that particular purpose.

In brief, authorize is used when giving permission and entitle is used when giving a right or privilege.

Empower.wordDefinition:
Empower means giving someone the power or ability to do something. For example, if a teacher empowers a student by giving them the tools to succeed in a subject, it means that the student feels more confident and capable in that subject.

Empower gives someone the ability to do something, while entitle gives someone the right to something. Empowerment is about building skills and confidence, while entitlement is about fulfilling legal or moral obligations.

Endow.wordDefinition:
Endow means to give someone a particular quality, ability, or asset. For example, a wealthy person might endow a university with a large sum of money to establish a new scholarship program.

Endow describes the act of giving something (like money, a skill, or a talent), while entitle describes the act of giving someone the right to something (like a ticket or an opinion).

Grant.wordDefinition:
Grant means to give something to someone, usually as a form of support or assistance. For example, a government might grant money to a nonprofit organization to fund their programs.

Entitle involves giving someone a right or privilege they have earned, while grant involves giving something to someone as a form of support or assistance.

Invest.wordDefinition:
Invest means to commit money or resources to something with the expectation of a profitable return. For example, if you invest money in the stock market, you are hoping to make a profit on your investment.

Entitle is about giving a right or claim to something while invest is about committing resources with the expectation of a return.

Permit.wordDefinition:
Permit means to allow or give permission for something to happen or be done. For example, you may need a permit to build a house or to park in certain areas.

The word entitle refers to giving someone a right or claim to something, while the word permit refers to allowing or giving permission for something to happen or be done.

Qualify.wordDefinition:
To qualify means that something or someone meets the necessary requirements or criteria to be considered for a particular position or benefit.

For example, if you want to apply for a job that requires a college degree, you would need to qualify by having that degree or its equivalent.

Entitle means you deserve something, while qualify means you meet the requirements to have something.

quotes.Text: I see kids and young adults walking the streets of L.A. with this enormous sense of entitlement, who seem to think that if they are basically good people and pay their bills, then the world will be good back to them. And I think life isn't always like that.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actress
quotes.Name: Evangeline Lilly

quotes.Text: In my own situation, I cannot show anything... And I believe that everybody now understands that, president or not president, one is entitled to have a private life. But of course when one is president, this creates duties and obligations.

quotes.Text: I felt that I had worked hard my entire life and deserved to enjoy all the temptations around me. I felt I was entitled, and thanks to money and fame, I didn't have to go far to find them.

quotes.Text: Entitled people drive me insane. The world owes you nothing! Get over it!

quotes.Text: I am afraid of privilege, of ease, of entitlement.

quotes.Text: I don't want to raise someone who feels entitled.
